botanical_details.genus: Aquilegia are clump-forming herbaceous perennials with long-stalked, ternately divided basal leaves and erect, leafy stems bearing bell-shaped flowers with spreading, coloured sepals and petals with spurs, on branched stems

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in fertile, moist but well-drained soil in full sun or partial shade. See aquilegia cultivation. Good in containers
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by seed; home-saved seed may not come true. Established plants can also be propagated by division in spring, but they dislike root disturbance and will be slow to recover
how_to_grow.pruning: To encourage more flowers (and prevent self-seeding) deadhead regularly. Cut back foliage after flowering to promote fresh growth in late summer
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to aphids, caterpillars, leaf miners, aquilegia gall midge and aquilegia sawfly
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to powdery mildews and aquilegia downy mildew
